text:
- So I'm a senior principal
engineer at Intercom,

which is a bit of a
mouthful, but it mostly means

that I do all of the
cloud stuff at Intercom.

And so Intercom is a startup,
though we're founded in 2011,
and we're based entirely on top of AWS.

And so we build, ship, and
deliver software at speed
to tens of thousands of customers
in multiple regions around the world,

and we deliver a AI-first
customer service platform.
So things started off very small

and we just had a handful
of EC2 servers, you know,
deploying our Ruby on Rails application
and just building and shipping stuff
and then things went a little wild.

We kind of reached product
market fit very quickly.
Lots of customers came on board.
We had lots of scaling problems.

We had to hire lots of
engineers and ship lots of code,
and this meant we were building
and scaling rapidly out in the cloud.

Fortunately, AWS, they're
pretty good at that job

of building and scaling and
of course, being secure,

and so we've been able
to build the business
to a pretty big size over the years,

and recently, we've been
shipping AI features,

and indeed, turning the
whole company around

to be a AI-first customer
service platform.

I'm excited about the
future of Intercom and AWS

because we're building and
shipping so many new features,
getting on board so many new customers
who have lots of different needs,
and we've been able to partner with AWS
with our product teams, with our services,
and with our support team

to be able to deliver these
services when we need them

and at the kinda level
of quality that we need.
